page.syntax: Result as C = ui_get_list2(C title ,C default ,C choices [,N style [,L preserve_selection_order [,L flagOwnerDraw [,C headingText [,N height [,N width ]]]]]])

argument.name: title
argument.description: The title of the dialog box.

argument.name: choices
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of choices to be shown in the dialog.

item.name: 2 = Multi-select (single click on an item in the list to add it to the list of selected values),
3 = Multi-select (use standard Windows behavior to select - hold down shift or control then click on an entry to extend the selection)

argument.name: preserve_selection_order
argument.description: Optional. Default = .F. If this property is set to TRUE (.T.) and the style allows multiple selections, the selections are returned in the order in which the selections were made.

page.description: Prompts user for selection from a CR-LF delimited list of choices. Style: 1 = single select, 2 = multi-select (click item to select), 3 = multi-select (Shift+Click, Ctrl+Click and Drag are supported)
page.discussion: The UI_GET_LIST2() function displays a dialog containing a list box of choices. The list of choices is not limited to 8 choices, and is passed into the function as a single argument (a CR-LF delimited list), rather than one argument per choice, as is the case with UI_GET_LIST().

section.title: Example
section.example: dim list as C dim res as C list = a5.Color_Enum() res = ui_get_list2("","",list,1) ui_msg_box("",res) res = ui_get_list2("","",list,2) ui_msg_box("",res) res = ui_get_list2("","",list,3) ui_msg_box("",res)

section.title: Returning a Multiple Values from a List
section.description: This example shows how to allow the user to select and return multiple values from a selection list produced by a function or method.
section.example: dim list as C dim tbl_name as C = "customer" list = ui_get_list2("Select Fields", "", table.external_field_name_get(tbl_name, "N"), 2)

page.original:
UI_GET_LIST2() Syntax Result as C = UI_GET_LIST2( Title as C, Default as C, Choices as C [, Style as N [, Preserve_Selection_Order as L ]] ) Argument Description Result The user selection. Title The title of the dialog box. Default The default selection. Choices A CR-LF delimited list of choices to be shown in the dialog. Style Optional. Default = 1.
1 = Single select
2 = Multi-select (single click on an item in the list to add it to the list of selected values),
3 = Multi-select (use standard Windows behavior to select - hold down shift or control then click on an entry to extend the selection) Preserve_Selection_Order Optional. Default = .F. If this property is set to TRUE (.T.) and the style allows multiple selections, the selections are returned in the order in which the selections were made.
Description The UI_GET_LIST2() function displays a dialog containing a list box of choices. The list of choices is not limited to 8 choices, and is passed into the function as a single argument (a CR-LF delimited list), rather than one argument per choice, as is the case with UI_GET_LIST(). Limitations Desktop applications only. Examples dim list as C dim res as C list = a5.Color_Enum() res = ui_get_list2("","",list,1) ui_msg_box("",res) res = ui_get_list2("","",list,2) ui_msg_box("",res) res = ui_get_list2("","",list,3) ui_msg_box("",res)
Returning a Multiple Values from a List This example shows how to allow the user to select and return multiple values from a selection list produced by a function or method. dim list as C dim tbl_name as C = "customer" list = ui_get_list2("Select Fields", "", table.external_field_name_get(tbl_name, "N"), 2)
